author: Special Correspondent
text:
Prakash Javadekar has vast experience in election management, especially in Gujarat when Narendra Modi was Chief Minister.— File photo

Union Minister for Environment and Forests Prakash Javadekar has been appointed the BJP’s 2016 Assembly elections in-charge for Tamil Nadu. The appointment was made by the party’s national president, Amit Shah, on Monday. Union Power Minister Piyush Goyal has been named joint in-charge.

Mr. Javadekar takes over the important position at a time his strategy to lift the ban on jallikattu has come under severe criticism by the Opposition parties. His move to amend a 2011 notification of the Environment Ministry and exclude the sport from the ambit of performances was struck down by the Supreme Court. The People’s Welfare Front had deemed the strategy a ploy to “hoodwink” the people of Tamil Nadu.

However, Mr. Javadekar has vast experience in election management, especially in Gujarat when Narendra Modi was Chief Minister. He has also been the BJP’s face in the media for several years.

Also, Mr. Javadekar is known to share a good rapport with BJP’s Tamil Nadu unit president Tamilisai Soundararajan. The two leaders, along with Union Minister Rajiv Pratap Rudy, had worked together for years in an intellectual forum in the party.
title: Javadekar to oversee BJP’s poll preparations
